title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to the Advancement by Countries of Concern in Sensitive Technologies and Products Critical for the Military, Intelligence, Surveillance, or Cyber-Enabled Capabilities of Such Countries
summary: The document is a presidential notice from August 6, 2025, regarding the continuation of the national emergency declared on August 9, 2023, by Executive Order 14105. The emergency addresses the threat posed by countries of concern advancing sensitive technologies and products critical for military, intelligence, surveillance, or cyber-enabled capabilities. The notice highlights that ongoing activities and strategies by these countries enhance their ability to threaten U.S. national security, and that certain U.S. outbound investments risk exacerbating this threat. As a result, the national emergency is extended for one year beyond August 9, 2025. The notice is published in the Federal Register and transmitted to Congress.
